qas.question: Which member of the Han Empire was sent to Daqin in AD 97?
Who translated written works into Chinese?
Who reached the court of Emperor Huan in AD 166?
When did Emperor Huan's reign begin?
Which empire sent the Han gifts?

context: In addition to tributary relations with the Kushans, the Han Empire received gifts from the <a4_0>Parthian<a4_0/> Empire, from a king in modern Burma, from a ruler in Japan, and initiated an unsuccessful mission to Daqin (Rome) in AD 97 with <a0_0>Gan Ying<a0_0/> as emissary. <a2_0>A Roman embassy<a2_0/> of Emperor Marcus Aurelius (r. 161–180 AD) is recorded in the Hou Hanshu to have reached the court of Emperor Huan of Han (r. <a3_0>AD 146<a3_0/>–168) in AD 166, yet Rafe de Crespigny asserts that this was most likely a group of Roman merchants. Other travelers to Eastern-Han China included <a1_0>Buddhist monks<a1_0/> who translated works into Chinese, such as An Shigao of Parthia, and Lokaksema from Kushan-era Gandhara, India.
